WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
 
Is this possible to set? All that needs to be done is specify the row # which needs to be repeated on each printed page. The Discussion Name above states how to do this in Excel 2007.
 
On a sidenote, is my presumption that this feature is also available in 2003 correct? I'd expect it is given it's a fairly necessary feature.
 
Regards,
N9ne
WorkItem.Summary: Page Setup -> Print Titles -> Sheet -> 'Rows to repeat at top'

Comments.Message:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<workbook xmlns="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/spreadsheetml/2006/main" xmlns:r="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/officeDocument/2006/relationships">
	<fileVersion appName="xl" lastEdited="4" lowestEdited="4" rupBuild="4505" />
	<workbookPr defaultThemeVersion="124226" />
	<bookViews>
		<workbookView xWindow="480" yWindow="60" windowWidth="15180" windowHeight="11640" />
	</bookViews>
	<sheets>
		<sheet name="Blad1" sheetId="1" r:id="rId1" />
		<sheet name="Blad2" sheetId="2" r:id="rId2" />
		<sheet name="Blad3" sheetId="3" r:id="rId3" />
	</sheets>
	<definedNames>
		<definedName name="_xlnm.Print_Titles" localSheetId="0">Blad1!$A:$E,Blad1!$1:$3</definedName>
		<definedName name="_xlnm.Print_Titles" localSheetId="1">Blad2!$A:$B,Blad2!$1:$2</definedName>
	</definedNames>
	<calcPr calcId="114210" fullCalcOnLoad="1" />
</workbook>

Will not be implemented in Excel2007 reader.
Only 2007 writer supports this feature.
